argument.name: Image_Name1 ... Image_NameN
argument.description: Character. A comma delimited list of the names of one or more bitmap images.

argument.name: Image_Number
argument.description: Numeric. Optional. Applicable to images that contain multiple sub-images. This is the sequence number, starting with 1 and ending with Image_Count, of the image to display.

argument.name: Image_Count
argument.description: Numeric. The number of sub-images in the image.

page.description: The I directive defines an image to place in a list box. When you have multiple directives in a Format string, you separate them with semi-colons ";".

section.title: Example
section.description: For example, the following script produces a dialog with two buttons. The "Save" button is drawn with a bitmap on it. This button uses an internal Alpha Anywhere image called "bluefloppy".
section.example: dim filelist100 as C data = <<%a% customer.dbf invoice_header.dbf invoice_items.dbf products.dbf invoices.set %a% data = stritran(data,".dbf",".1") data = stritran(data,".set",".2") filelist.initialize(data) filelist.sort() result = ui_dlg_box("Select Table/Set",<<%dlg% {region} %I=$a5_table,$a5_set;O={I=@$(.)+1} {@1,$(.)-1}%.25,10filename^#filelist| {endregion}; <10OK> <10Cancel> %dlg%)

section.description: This script produces the following dialog:
